intro: Cyrtandra schizocalyx, commonly known as the Hawaiian false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Cyrtandra schizocalyx plays an important role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii's unique flora.
